private_information: I can move disks A B C D
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute to achieving the global goal configuration by executing moves restricted to disks A B C D

private_information: I can move disks E F G
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute to achieving the global goal configuration by executing moves restricted to disks E F G

private_information: I can move disks H I J
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Contribute to achieving the global goal configuration by executing moves restricted to disks H I J

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and must integrate their move sequences
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner
orchestrator.goal: Produce an integrated plan and a PDDL domain and problem that realize the global goal configuration using the agents' allowed moves

public_information: This is a cooperative three agent Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A through J where A is smallest and J is largest
There are three pegs named left middle right
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B
Rules: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may not be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may move A B C D, agent_2 may move E F G, agent_3 may move H I J

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can only move disks A B C D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume actions for disks you cannot move. Be explicit about source and destination pegs using the names left middle right.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Your partial objective is: {agents->agent_1->goal} Think step by step and produce a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will execute, in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks A B C D. Make sure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and that the ordering is consistent with the global goal.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can only move disks E F G. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume actions for disks you cannot move. Be explicit about source and destination pegs using the names left middle right.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Your partial objective is: {agents->agent_2->goal} Think step by step and produce a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will execute, in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks E F G. Make sure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and that the ordering is consistent with the global goal.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can only move disks H I J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent disk restrictions. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume actions for disks you cannot move. Be explicit about source and destination pegs using the names left middle right.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information} Your partial objective is: {agents->agent_3->goal} Think step by step and produce a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will execute, in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves for disks H I J. Make sure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and that the ordering is consistent with the global goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You must integrate the move lists from the three agents and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represent the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance suitable for the FastDownward planner. The domain must include distinct action schemas or action names for each agent to reflect their disk movement restrictions. The problem must encode the initial configuration and the goal configuration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility and avoid constructs unsupported by FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the environment public facts: {environment->public_information} Here are the agents private facts: agent_1 {agents->agent_1->private_information} agent_2 {agents->agent_2->private_information} agent_3 {agents->agent_3->private_information} Here are the move sequences produced by the agents: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3} Your task is to integrate these sequences into a single correct plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem that represent the instance and allow FastDownward to find the plan. Keep agent actions distinct, encode disk sizes and legal placement constraints, and ensure the initial and goal states match the environment specification. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
